title: ENIAC
description: The ENIAC was the world’s first general-purpose electronic digital computer, used by the U.S. Army for artillery trajectory calculations.

title: UNIVAC I
description: The UNIVAC I was the first commercially produced electronic computer in the United States.

title: IBM 701
description: The IBM 701, IBM’s first mass-produced scientific computer, marked the company’s entry into electronic computing.

title: Apple I
description: The Apple I, hand-built by Steve Wozniak and sold by Steve Jobs, sparked the personal computing wave.

title: IBM PC (5150)
description: The IBM PC 5150 set the industry standard for home and business desktop computers.

title: Macintosh
description: Apple’s first Macintosh popularized the graphical user interface (GUI) for home computers.

title: Apple iPhone
description: The original iPhone revolutionized mobile computing and ignited the smartphone era.

title: Apple iPad
description: The iPad created a new market for tablet computing and broadened personal device use.
